title: Cultivating Awareness
sub_title: Seeing God in the Untamed Garden
devotional:
Eliza was a meticulous gardener. Every spring, she would spend hours preparing her soil, carefully planting seeds, and diligently weeding and watering. Her garden was her sanctuary, a place where she felt closest to God. One year, however, Eliza decided to try something different. Instead of meticulously planning and controlling every aspect of her garden, she decided to simply scatter a mix of wildflower seeds and let nature take its course. She still provided water, but she refrained from her usual obsessive weeding, choosing instead to observe and appreciate whatever emerged.

Initially, Eliza felt uneasy. Her garden looked chaotic and unkempt compared to previous years. Weeds sprouted alongside the wildflowers, and she worried that her experiment was a failure. However, as the weeks passed, something beautiful began to unfold. A vibrant tapestry of colors and textures emerged, a wild and untamed beauty that she had never witnessed before. The wildflowers attracted a myriad of pollinators, and the garden buzzed with life. Eliza realized that by relinquishing control and allowing nature to take its course, she had created something far more magnificent than she could have ever imagined.

This experience taught Eliza a valuable lesson about awareness and trust. She realized that she often approached life with the same meticulous control she had once applied to her garden, trying to plan and manage every detail. However, by doing so, she often missed out on the beauty and wonder that God was trying to reveal to her. Just as Eliza learned to appreciate the wildness of her garden, we too can learn to embrace the unexpected twists and turns of life, trusting that God is working in ways we cannot always see.

Today, let us cultivate an awareness of God's presence in the ordinary moments of our lives. Let us release our need for control and open ourselves to the unexpected blessings that He has in store for us. May we learn to appreciate the wildness and untamed beauty of His creation, trusting that He is working all things together for our good.
image_description: A field of diverse wildflowers in full bloom, bathed in the soft light of dawn.
insights: Eliza's experience resonates with the concept of 'beginner's mind' in Zen Buddhism, which encourages us to approach life with openness and a lack of preconceptions. Similarly, Jesus taught His disciples to become like children (Matthew 18:3), implying a willingness to learn and see the world with fresh eyes. This openness allows us to perceive God's presence in unexpected places and to receive His guidance without resistance. Proverbs 3:5-6 encourages us to 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight,' highlighting the importance of surrendering our control and trusting in God's wisdom.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often struggle to relinquish control and trust in Your plan for my life. Help me to cultivate an awareness of Your presence in the ordinary moments of each day. Open my eyes to the beauty and wonder of Your creation, and grant me the wisdom to embrace the unexpected twists and turns of life. May I learn to surrender my will to Yours, trusting that You are working all things together for my good. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Where in your life are you currently clinging to control? What would it look like to surrender that control to God? How can you cultivate an awareness of God's presence in the midst of your daily routine?
